title: Valle Mesolcina
text:
The Valle Mesolcina, also known as the Val Mesolcina or Misox (German), is an <a href="Swiss%20Alps">alpine</a> valley of the <a href="Grisons">Grisons</a>, <a href="Switzerland">Switzerland</a>, stretching from the <a href="San%20Bernardino%20Pass">San Bernardino Pass</a> to <a href="Grono%2C%20Switzerland">Grono</a> where it joins the <a href="Val%20Calanca">Calanca Valley</a>. It is the valley formed by the river <a href="Moesa%20%28river%29">Moesa</a>.
Like the <a href="Val%20Bregaglia">Val Bregaglia</a> or the <a href="Val%20Poschiavo">Val Poschiavo</a>, the Valle Mesolcina is a valley lying south of the main ridge of the <a href="Alps">Alps</a>. Although politically the Valle Mesolcina belongs to the Grisons, its population is predominantly Italian-speaking and culturally oriented towards the <a href="Ticino">Ticino</a>.
The valley includes the Mesocco and Roveredo of the <a href="Moesa%20district">Moesa district</a>, including:
